hypothesis_content.title: Defensive Rotation on Failed Liquidity Recovery
hypothesis_content.statement: If aggregate crypto market depth fails to recover (remains >20% below its 30-day average) for 5 consecutive days following a neutral-to-bullish news catalyst (e.g., Fed dovish commentary), capital will rotate defensively into high-liquidity, large-cap tokens (BTC, ETH) at the expense of mid-cap alts, creating a short-term mean-reversion opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A failure of liquidity to respond to positive news is a strong signal of underlying market fragility and 'thin' rallies. In this environment, savvy capital seeks safety and liquidity, favoring the deepest pools (BTC, then ETH), causing a temporary but tradable compression in the ETH/BTC ratio before a potential broader downturn.
entry_conditions: A positive macro catalyst occurs (headline sentiment score >0.6)
Aggregate order book depth for top 50 assets remains >20% below its 30D MA for 5 days post-catalyst
ETH/BTC ratio is at or below its 10-day low

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close trade when the ETH/BTC ratio mean-reverts to its 10-day average or after 7 trading days.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close if the ETH/BTC ratio makes a new 5-day low.
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit at market on close of the 7th trading day post-entry.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Falsified if, in the described conditions, the ETH/BTC ratio continues to decline (fails to mean-revert) in >65% of instances, indicating the rotation is not temporary but a sustained flight to the absolute safest asset (BTC only).
